timeline.bodyText:
Is this change really necessary? It does work in the GraalVM 20.2.0 console (CCing @woess):
./graalvm-ce-java8-20.2.0/bin/js --jvm
> let Long = Java.type("java.lang.Long");
> new Long(33)
33
> new Long("33")
33
It would be surprising that the interop behaves differently in the console and in our ScriptEngine...
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach

replies.bodyText: Well, this is the error that I ran into in CI and also later confirmed locally. Maybe there is a way to turn this off in ScriptEngine configuration?
replies.author: daemontus
JaroslavTulach

replies.bodyText:
Yes, this is a known consequence of the new conversion and also a known workaround that removes the new conversion see oracle/graaljs#286
Note that the conversion itself is not incorrect (in the sense that Nashorn has it as well and so some Nashorn users need it). Unfortunately, the inclusion of the conversion discloses that our method resolution (in truffle) is different than Nashorn one.
replies.author: iamstolis

timeline.message: CI: Run GraalVM tests on both latest and LTS version
Increase test memory limit for graal-sdk tests
Workaround for GR-26188. Calling polyglot.js.allowHostAccess replaces NASHORN_HOST_ACCESS with ALL.
Compare the signatures against previous release
Regenerating GraalSDK and Truffle API signature to match 20.2.0 version
Adjusting other .sig files to now enabled 'ant check-sigtests-release' test
Increasing spec versions of all three Graal.js related modules as they depend on each other
